README.html.title: ASE semester 1 2025 Portfolio | MyBOOSE_Doc
README.html.summary: ASE semester 1 2025 Portfolio Basic Object Orientated Software Engineering (BOOSE). Riaz Ahmed group 3 Each element is covered in the weekly sessions, using the BOOSE library source code as an example. I will discuss how I implemented the more difficult elements (like the parser, implementing loops etc.) Keep your progress up to date below. Put "DONE" after each section, when you have done it. The number in brackets represents the component that each element contributes to. Checkpoint 1 Version Control (1) (DONE) At least two documented commits to provided on GitHub Classroom BEFORE 12pm 7th October. At least 5 documented commits. Readme.md file filled in correctly. 2 Unit Tests for basic drawing commands above (1) (DONE) Unit Test for moveto command (variables storing pen position are correct) Unit Test for drawTo command (variables storing pen position are correct) Unit Test for a multiline program. 3 XML Comments/documentation produced (1) DONE Fully documented with XML comments and Documentation web site produced https://github.com/RiazAhmed0113/BOOSE-Doc-Riaz.git 4 Exception Handling (1) (DONE) 5 Library (DLL) installed and working with reasonable user interface (2) (DONE) Form interface with program window, output window and run button BOOSE DLL library installed call about method and display returned information in output/debug window you can use System.Diagnostics to output to the debug window 6 Basic drawing commands of the library are implemented (2) (DONE) Moveto, circle, rect, pencolour, write. Unrestricted drawing programs can be run (1unrestrictedDrawing.boose) You MUST fill in the this form before submission and submit your zipped up project to myBeckett Read the hand in instructions on myBeckett carefully to ensure you are submitting everything correctly, as if you don't you may be subject to a penalty. Final Submission 1 Further Version Control (1) You must continue to use VC to a professional standard with frequent and clear commits Your Readme.md must be up to date 2 Use of Interfaces (1) Interfaces to be used for all classes where appropriate 3 Further Unit Testing (1) Tests for full program all of the facilities completed in 5,6 and 7 below It is up to you how design your tests (i.e. one test per facility or one test testing many but they must be clearly documented with XML comments) 4 Design Patterns (1) Use of factory Design Pattern for command creation Use of Singleton Design Pattern Demonstrate the use of another design pattern of your choice (for 5,6 and 7 you can click the links to see the example BOOSE programs that must be run, these are in your Portfolio. You must run the unrestricted programs and replace the image already there with an image of your BOOSE Interpreter running the BOOSE programs. You may show further programs in your portfolio.) 5 Replaced variables (2) * Int Real Array 6 Replaced if, while, for (2) * While For If else 7 Replaced Methods (2) * 8 Additional (web version, text-based version, extension to BOOSE itself, etc, discuss with your tutor) (2) * You must rewrite the functionality and not try and "hack the system". I've tried to make it so you can't but who knows, either way, you've been told. You MUST fill in this form whilst recording your YouTube Video AND submit it to myBeckett Read the hand in instructions on myBeckett carefully to ensure you are submitting everything correctly, as if you don't you may be subject to a penalty. Links These are for convinience. Check on myBeckett in the Assessment directory for any up to date links. BOOSE Documentation BOOSE DLL Download Assignment Specification - including all university details Detailed Assignment Information - with marking scheme Assignment Help Videos Remember that BOOSE.DLL maybe updated, as it may have bugs in it, or new features may be added. Keep updated on Discord and make sure you always have the latest version in your project. V1.0

api/BOOSE_App.AppArray.html.title: Class AppArray | MyBOOSE_Doc
api/BOOSE_App.AppArray.html.summary: Class AppArray Namespace BOOSE_App Assembly BOOSE_App.dll Handles array declarations of the form: array int name = <sizeExpr> array real name = <sizeExpr> Also accepts the shorthand without '=': array int name <sizeExpr> Creates and registers the array in the preprocessor state. public class AppArray : ILineHandler Inheritance object AppArray Implements ILineHandler Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Methods TryHandle(string, IPreprocessorState, IExpressionEvaluator, out string?, out string?) Attempt to handle a raw source line during preprocessing. public bool TryHandle(string line, IPreprocessorState state, IExpressionEvaluator evaluator, out string? outProcessedLine, out string? outError) Parameters line string Raw source line to inspect. state IPreprocessorState Current IPreprocessorState. Handlers may read from and mutate this state (declare variables, update arrays, set temporaries, etc.). evaluator IExpressionEvaluator IExpressionEvaluator instance to evaluate numeric or boolean expressions when needed. outProcessedLine string When the method returns true this out parameter indicates the line to forward to the parser. A null value means the handler consumed the line and it should be dropped. outError string When the method returns true and an error occurred during handling, this contains a user-facing error message. Otherwise it should be null. Returns bool true if the handler recognized the line (even if an error occurred), otherwise false. Returning false indicates the preprocessor should try other handlers.

api/BOOSE_App.AppBoolean.html.title: Class AppBoolean | MyBOOSE_Doc
api/BOOSE_App.AppBoolean.html.summary: Class AppBoolean Namespace BOOSE_App Assembly BOOSE_App.dll Preprocessor line handler for boolean declarations and optional initialization. Recognises lines of the form: "boolean <name>" (declare) "boolean <name> = <expr>" (declare and initialise) When handled the declaration is consumed by the preprocessor (no runtime output) and the named boolean variable is created/updated in the provided IPreprocessorState. public class AppBoolean : ILineHandler Inheritance object AppBoolean Implements ILineHandler Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Methods TryHandle(string, IPreprocessorState, IExpressionEvaluator, out string?, out string?) Try to handle a single source line as a boolean declaration/assignment. If the line is recognised the handler returns true. On success the line is consumed by the preprocessor (the returned outProcessedLine is null). If an error occurs while evaluating the initializer the handler returns true and sets outError to a user-facing message. public bool TryHandle(string line, IPreprocessorState state, IExpressionEvaluator evaluator, out string? outProcessedLine, out string? outError) Parameters line string The raw source line to examine. state IPreprocessorState Shared preprocessor state where boolean variables are stored. evaluator IExpressionEvaluator Expression evaluator used to evaluate boolean expressions. outProcessedLine string When the handler consumes the line this is set to null (indicates drop). If the handler does not recognise the line the out parameter value is ignored. outError string On error this will contain a concise, user-facing message describing the failure (for example, expression evaluation errors). When handling succeeds this remains null. Returns bool true if the handler recognised the line (even if it produced an error), otherwise false.

api/BOOSE_App.AppCanvas.html.title: Class AppCanvas | MyBOOSE_Doc
api/BOOSE_App.AppCanvas.html.summary: Class AppCanvas Namespace BOOSE_App Assembly BOOSE_App.dll Simple bitmap canvas implementation of ICanvas from BOOSE Provides basic drawing methods like moveto, drawto, circle, rect, tri, writetext. public class AppCanvas : ICanvas Inheritance object AppCanvas Implements ICanvas Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Constructors AppCanvas(int, int) Initializes a new instance of the AppCanvas class. public AppCanvas(int xsize, int ysize) Parameters xsize int The width of the bitmap in pixels. ysize int The height of the bitmap in pixels. Properties PenColour Gets or sets the current pen colour. Accepts a Color or an ARGB integer. public object PenColour { get; set; } Property Value object The pen colour. Xpos Gets or sets the xpos. public int Xpos { get; set; } Property Value int The xpos. Ypos Gets or sets the ypos. public int Ypos { get; set; } Property Value int The ypos. Methods Circle(int, bool) Draws Circle with the specified radius. public void Circle(int radius, bool filled) Parameters radius int Radius in pixels, must be greater than or equal to 1. filled bool if set to true [filled], else it just draws the outline. Clear() Clears the canvas and text box. public void Clear() DrawTo(int, int) Draws from one point to another. Provide the x and y coordinates to draw to. public void DrawTo(int x, int y) Parameters x int Target X coordinate. y int Target Y coordinate. MoveTo(int, int) Moves the pen point to the specified coordinates without drawing. public void MoveTo(int x, int y) Parameters x int Provide X coordinate. y int Provide Y coordinate. Rect(int, int, bool) Draws Rectangle at the current pen position with the specified width and height. Rectangle is centered on the pen position so it aligns with Circle's centering. public void Rect(int width, int height, bool filled) Parameters width int The width measured in pixels, must be greater than or equal to 1. height int The height measured in pixels, must be greater than or equal to 1. filled bool if set to true [filled], else, draws only the outline. Reset() Resets the pen position, colour and width to defaults and clears canvas. public void Reset() Set(int, int) Sets the specified width. public void Set(int width, int height) Parameters width int The width. height int The height. SetColour(int, int, int) Sets the colour. public void SetColour(int red, int green, int blue) Parameters red int The red. green int The green. blue int The blue. Tri(int, int) Draws triangle using the pen position as the top vertex. public void Tri(int width, int height) Parameters width int The base width in pixels. height int The height in pixels. WriteText(string) Draws text at the current pen position using a default font. Text is queued and composited on top of shapes so it is never covered. public void WriteText(string text) Parameters text string Text to draw. getBitmap() Gets the bitmap used for rendering. public object getBitmap() Returns object The internal Bitmap instance with text composited on top. See Also ICanvas

api/BOOSE_App.AppCanvasSingleton.html.title: Class AppCanvasSingleton | MyBOOSE_Doc
api/BOOSE_App.AppCanvasSingleton.html.summary: Class AppCanvasSingleton Namespace BOOSE_App Assembly BOOSE_App.dll Simple singleton holder for AppCanvas. Provides a non-invasive wrapper so the application can obtain a single shared canvas instance without changing the concrete AppCanvas implementation. public static class AppCanvasSingleton Inheritance object AppCanvasSingleton Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Remarks Call Initialize(int, int) once at application startup (for example in the main form constructor) to create the internal AppCanvas instance. After initialization, access the shared instance via the Instance property. Properties Instance Gets the shared AppCanvas instance. public static AppCanvas Instance { get; } Property Value AppCanvas Exceptions InvalidOperationException Thrown when Initialize(int, int) has not been called prior to accessing this property. Methods Initialize(int, int) Initializes the shared AppCanvas instance with the specified size. This method is idempotent: subsequent calls have no effect once the instance has been created. public static void Initialize(int width, int height) Parameters width int Initial canvas width in pixels. height int Initial canvas height in pixels.

api/BOOSE_App.AppCircle.html.title: Class AppCircle | MyBOOSE_Doc
api/BOOSE_App.AppCircle.html.summary: Class AppCircle Namespace BOOSE_App Assembly BOOSE_App.dll Circle command to enable unrestricted circle drawing. Lets user input higher radius values. public class AppCircle : CommandOneParameter, ICommand Inheritance object Command CanvasCommand CommandOneParameter AppCircle Implements ICommand Inherited Members CommandOneParameter.param1 CommandOneParameter.param1unprocessed CommandOneParameter.CheckParameters(string[]) CanvasCommand.yPos CanvasCommand.xPos CanvasCommand.canvas CanvasCommand.Canvas Command.IsDouble Command.program Command.parameterList Command.parameters Command.paramsint Command.Set(StoredProgram, string) Command.Compile() Command.ProcessParameters(string) Command.ToString() Command.Program Command.Name Command.ParameterList Command.Parameters Command.Paramsint object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) Remarks This class derives from BOOSE.CommandOneParameter to handle a single integer parameter for the circle radius. Constructors AppCircle() Initializes a new instance of the AppCircle class. It also validates parameters and throws exceptions if invalid. public AppCircle() AppCircle(Canvas, int) Initializes a new instance of the AppCircle class. public AppCircle(Canvas c, int radius) Parameters c Canvas Canvas instance used to draw the circle. radius int Initial radius for the command. Methods Execute() Executes the circle drawing command. public override void Execute() Remarks Execution reads the parsed parameter (from the base class), then validates it and then draws an unfilled circle using Circle(int, bool)."/> Exceptions CanvasException An exception is thrown when the command was given double parameters or when the radius is less than 1. The messages will be displayed to the user in the UI error log box.

api/BOOSE_App.AppCommandFactory.html.title: Class AppCommandFactory | MyBOOSE_Doc
api/BOOSE_App.AppCommandFactory.html.summary: Class AppCommandFactory Namespace BOOSE_App Assembly BOOSE_App.dll Factory that creates application-specific BOOSE.ICommand instances. Returns application-provided command implementations for commands the application overrides (for example "circle", "rect", "moveto") and delegates to the base BOOSE.CommandFactory for any other command names. public class AppCommandFactory : CommandFactory, ICommandFactory Inheritance object CommandFactory AppCommandFactory Implements ICommandFactory Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Examples var factory = new AppCommandFactory(); var cmd = factory.MakeCommand("circle"); // returns an AppCircle instance Remarks This class demonstrates the Factory design pattern by encapsulating the creation of concrete BOOSE.ICommand objects. The parser/requesting code should pass the command keyword (typically lower-case) to MakeCommand(string) and receive a ready-to-use BOOSE.ICommand instance. Methods MakeCommand(string) public override ICommand MakeCommand(string commandType) Parameters commandType string Returns ICommand See Also CommandFactory

api/BOOSE_App.AppFor.html.title: Class AppFor | MyBOOSE_Doc
api/BOOSE_App.AppFor.html.summary: Class AppFor Namespace BOOSE_App Assembly BOOSE_App.dll Preprocessor block handler for FOR...END FOR constructs. The handler unrolls FOR loops at preprocess time, updating IPreprocessorState and emitting the runtime lines that should be executed for each iteration. public static class AppFor Inheritance object AppFor Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Methods TryHandleBlock(string[], ref int, IPreprocessorState, IExpressionEvaluator, out List<string>, out string?, int) Try handle a FOR...END FOR block starting at index in the lines array. public static bool TryHandleBlock(string[] lines, ref int index, IPreprocessorState state, IExpressionEvaluator eval, out List<string> outProcessed, out string? outError, int baseLineNo = 1) Parameters lines string[] All source lines (normalized to '\n' splitting). index int Index of the current line (on entry this should point at the FOR header). On successful handling the index will be advanced to the matching END FOR line. state IPreprocessorState Shared preprocessor state used to store variables and method results. eval IExpressionEvaluator Expression evaluator used to evaluate numeric and boolean expressions. outProcessed List<string> When the block is handled this receives the list of processed runtime lines emitted by the unrolled loop. outError string If handling produced one or more errors this contains a concise user-facing message; otherwise null. baseLineNo int 1-based line number offset used when producing user-facing error messages (default 1). This should normally be the line number of the first element in lines in the original source. Returns bool true if the handler recognised and handled a FOR block starting at index; otherwise false. When true the FOR block is considered consumed and the calling preprocessor should not attempt other handlers for the same lines.

api/BOOSE_App.AppIfs.html.title: Class AppIfs | MyBOOSE_Doc
api/BOOSE_App.AppIfs.html.summary: Class AppIfs Namespace BOOSE_App Assembly BOOSE_App.dll Simple block handler for IF / ELSEIF / ELSE / END IF constructs used by the preprocessor. public static class AppIfs Inheritance object AppIfs Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Remarks This class parses an IF block, evaluates conditions using IExpressionEvaluator, executes the first matching section by processing lines (possibly recursing into nested blocks), and emits the runtime lines that should be forwarded to the parser. Implementations of handlers and callers should pass IPreprocessorState and IExpressionEvaluator so the preprocessor can be mocked or substituted in tests. Methods TryHandleBlock(string[], ref int, IPreprocessorState, IExpressionEvaluator, out List<string>, out string?, int) Try to handle an IF ... END IF block beginning at index in lines. public static bool TryHandleBlock(string[] lines, ref int index, IPreprocessorState state, IExpressionEvaluator eval, out List<string> outProcessed, out string? outError, int baseLineNo = 1) Parameters lines string[] All source lines (normalized with '\n' splitting). index int Index of the current line (on entry this should point at the IF header). On successful handling the index will be advanced to the matching END IF line. state IPreprocessorState Preprocessor state used to read and mutate named variables, arrays and registered methods. See IPreprocessorState. eval IExpressionEvaluator Expression evaluator used to evaluate boolean and numeric expressions. See IExpressionEvaluator. outProcessed List<string> When the block is handled this receives the list of processed runtime lines emitted by the selected section. Each line is ready to be forwarded to the runtime parser (variables substituted and simple arithmetic evaluated). outError string If handling produced one or more errors this contains a concise user-facing message; otherwise null. Errors include unterminated blocks or evaluation errors for conditions. baseLineNo int 1-based line number offset used when producing user-facing error messages (default 1). Typically the line number of the first element in lines in the original source. Returns bool true if the handler recognised and handled an IF block starting at index; otherwise false. When true the IF block is considered consumed and the calling preprocessor should not attempt other handlers for the same lines.

api/BOOSE_App.AppMethod.html.title: Class AppMethod | MyBOOSE_Doc
api/BOOSE_App.AppMethod.html.summary: Class AppMethod Namespace BOOSE_App Assembly BOOSE_App.dll Preprocessor handler for METHOD ... END METHOD blocks and CALL invocations. public class AppMethod : ILineHandler Inheritance object AppMethod Implements ILineHandler Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Remarks TryHandleBlock(string[], ref int, IPreprocessorState, IExpressionEvaluator, out List<string>, out string?, int) parses and registers METHOD declarations in the provided IPreprocessorState (adds entries to Methods). TryHandle(string, IPreprocessorState, IExpressionEvaluator, out string?, out string?) handles runtime-style "call" lines by binding parameters, executing the method body at preprocess time and storing the return value. Methods TryHandle(string, IPreprocessorState, IExpressionEvaluator, out string?, out string?) Try to handle a single "call" invocation line. When a call is handled the method body is executed at preprocess time with parameters bound into temporary variables, the method return is stored in the preprocessor state and the call line is consumed (not forwarded). public bool TryHandle(string line, IPreprocessorState state, IExpressionEvaluator evaluator, out string? outProcessedLine, out string? outError) Parameters line string The raw source line to inspect (expected form: "call name [arg1 arg2 ...]"). state IPreprocessorState Current preprocessor state containing variable tables and registered methods. evaluator IExpressionEvaluator Expression evaluator used to evaluate parameter and assignment expressions. outProcessedLine string When handled: processed output line to forward to the parser; a null value indicates the call was consumed by the preprocessor. When not handled: remains null and the method returns false. outError string On failure contains an error message describing the problem; otherwise null. Returns bool true if the line was recognized as a call (even if it produced an error), otherwise false. TryHandleBlock(string[], ref int, IPreprocessorState, IExpressionEvaluator, out List<string>, out string?, int) Parse a METHOD ... END METHOD block beginning at index in lines. On success the method declaration is registered in state.Methods and the index is advanced to the END METHOD line. public static bool TryHandleBlock(string[] lines, ref int index, IPreprocessorState state, IExpressionEvaluator eval, out List<string> outProcessed, out string? outError, int baseLineNo = 1) Parameters lines string[] The full source lines array (normalized by the caller). index int Index of the starting line; on return this is advanced to the matching END METHOD index when a METHOD block is handled. state IPreprocessorState Preprocessor state used to register the method return variable and to store the method declaration. eval IExpressionEvaluator Expression evaluator (header parsing does not use the evaluator but it is provided for API consistency). outProcessed List<string> Output list of processed lines produced by the block. For METHOD blocks this list is normally empty. outError string When parsing fails contains a concise, user-facing error message; otherwise null. baseLineNo int Base line number offset used when producing user-facing error messages (default 1). Returns bool true if a METHOD block was recognized at index (even if an error occurred), otherwise false. When true the caller should not attempt other handlers for the same lines.

api/BOOSE_App.AppMoveTo.html.title: Class AppMoveTo | MyBOOSE_Doc
api/BOOSE_App.AppMoveTo.html.summary: Class AppMoveTo Namespace BOOSE_App Assembly BOOSE_App.dll Command that moves the current pen position to a specifc coordinate on the canvas public class AppMoveTo : CommandTwoParameters, ICommand Inheritance object Command CanvasCommand CommandOneParameter CommandTwoParameters AppMoveTo Implements ICommand Inherited Members CommandTwoParameters.param2 CommandTwoParameters.param2unprocessed CommandTwoParameters.CheckParameters(string[]) CommandOneParameter.param1 CommandOneParameter.param1unprocessed CanvasCommand.yPos CanvasCommand.xPos CanvasCommand.canvas CanvasCommand.Canvas Command.IsDouble Command.program Command.parameterList Command.parameters Command.paramsint Command.Set(StoredProgram, string) Command.Compile() Command.ProcessParameters(string) Command.ToString() Command.Program Command.Name Command.ParameterList Command.Parameters Command.Paramsint object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) Remarks This class derives from CommandTwoParemeters and expects two integer parameters: the X and Y coordinates. The command validates parameter types and ranges and throws user-facing BOOSE.CanvasException messages for invalid input. Constructors AppMoveTo() Initializes a new instance of the AppMoveTo class. Used by the command factory when creating a command with no runtime parameters. public AppMoveTo() AppMoveTo(Canvas, int, int) Initializes a new instance of the AppMoveTo class with a canvas and coordinates. public AppMoveTo(Canvas c, int x, int y) Parameters c Canvas Canvas instance to operate on. x int Initial X coordinate for the command. y int Initial Y coordinate for the command. Methods Execute() Executes the moveto command. public override void Execute() Remarks The method: Invokes the base execution to ensure parameters are parsed. Rejects double parameters (floating point) with a BOOSE.CanvasException. Reads integer parameters from the base Paramsint collection. Validates that coordinates are non-negative and moves the canvas pen position via MoveTo(int, int). Exceptions CanvasException Thrown when the command was supplied double parameters or when coordinates are negative. The exception message is intended to be user-facing and displayed in the application's error log. See Also CommandTwoParameters

api/BOOSE_App.AppPeek.html.title: Class AppPeek | MyBOOSE_Doc
api/BOOSE_App.AppPeek.html.summary: Class AppPeek Namespace BOOSE_App Assembly BOOSE_App.dll Handles "peek target = arrName index" preprocessing lines. Reads an element from an integer or real array and stores it in a declared scalar variable. public class AppPeek : ILineHandler Inheritance object AppPeek Implements ILineHandler Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Remarks This handler is used at preprocessing time to transfer array element values into scalar variables. It supports a small typo-correction heuristic for array names via FindClosestName(string, IPreprocessorState). When handled the line is consumed by the preprocessor (not forwarded to the runtime parser). Methods TryHandle(string, IPreprocessorState, IExpressionEvaluator, out string?, out string?) Attempt to handle a single "peek" line. public bool TryHandle(string line, IPreprocessorState state, IExpressionEvaluator evaluator, out string? outProcessedLine, out string? outError) Parameters line string Raw source line to inspect (expected form: peek <target> = <arrayName> <indexExpr>). state IPreprocessorState Preprocessor state used to read arrays and write target scalar variables (IPreprocessorState). evaluator IExpressionEvaluator Expression evaluator used to compute the index expression (IExpressionEvaluator). outProcessedLine string When the method returns true this out parameter indicates the line to forward to the parser. For peek the line is always consumed during preprocessing so this will be null. outError string On failure contains a concise user-facing error message; otherwise null. Returns bool true if the line was recognised as a peek invocation (even if an error occurred), otherwise false. Exceptions IndexOutOfRangeException Thrown internally when the evaluated index is negative or out of range. KeyNotFoundException Thrown internally when the target variable or array name is not found.

api/BOOSE_App.AppPoke.html.title: Class AppPoke | MyBOOSE_Doc
api/BOOSE_App.AppPoke.html.summary: Class AppPoke Namespace BOOSE_App Assembly BOOSE_App.dll Handles preprocessing lines of the form poke <array> <indexExpr> = <expr>. Evaluates the index and expression, and writes the computed value into the named integer or real array in the provided IPreprocessorState. This handler consumes the source line (does not forward it). public class AppPoke : ILineHandler Inheritance object AppPoke Implements ILineHandler Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Methods TryHandle(string, IPreprocessorState, IExpressionEvaluator, out string?, out string?) Attempt to handle a single poke line during preprocessing. public bool TryHandle(string line, IPreprocessorState state, IExpressionEvaluator evaluator, out string? outProcessedLine, out string? outError) Parameters line string Raw source line to inspect. state IPreprocessorState Current IPreprocessorState. The handler reads the target arrays and writes the element value. evaluator IExpressionEvaluator IExpressionEvaluator used to evaluate the index expression and the right-hand expression. outProcessedLine string When the method returns true this out parameter indicates the line to forward to the parser. For poke this handler always consumes the line so the value will be null. outError string When the method returns true and an error occurred during handling, this contains a concise, user-facing error message. Otherwise it is null. Returns bool true if the handler recognized the line (even if an error occurred), otherwise false.

api/BOOSE_App.AppWhile.html.summary: Class AppWhile Namespace BOOSE_App Assembly BOOSE_App.dll Simple block handler for WHILE ... May contain numeric literals, parentheses and + - * / operators and variable identifiers. state IPreprocessorState Current preprocessor state containing numeric variable values used for substitution. api/BOOSE_App.ILineHandler.html.title: Interface ILineHandler | MyBOOSE_Doc
api/BOOSE_App.ILineHandler.html.summary: Interface ILineHandler Namespace BOOSE_App Assembly BOOSE_App.dll Represents a preprocessing line handler. Implementations inspect a single source line and may consume it (perform actions against the IPreprocessorState) or produce a transformed line to be forwarded to the parser. public interface ILineHandler Methods TryHandle(string, IPreprocessorState, IExpressionEvaluator, out string?, out string?) Attempt to handle a raw source line during preprocessing. bool TryHandle(string line, IPreprocessorState state, IExpressionEvaluator evaluator, out string? outProcessedLine, out string? outError) Parameters line string Raw source line to inspect. state IPreprocessorState Current IPreprocessorState. Handlers may read from and mutate this state (declare variables, update arrays, set temporaries, etc.). evaluator IExpressionEvaluator IExpressionEvaluator instance to evaluate numeric or boolean expressions when needed. outProcessedLine string When the method returns true this out parameter indicates the line to forward to the parser. A null value means the handler consumed the line and it should be dropped. outError string When the method returns true and an error occurred during handling, this contains a user-facing error message. Otherwise it should be null. Returns bool true if the handler recognized the line (even if an error occurred), otherwise false. Returning false indicates the preprocessor should try other handlers.

AppIfsTests Unit tests for the AppIfs preprocessor block handler. Tests verify that IF/ELSE sections are selected and processed correctly given prepopulated state. AppMethodTests Unit tests for the AppMethod preprocessor handler. Verifies method declaration parsing, registration and that a subsequent "call" invocation executes the method body at preprocess time and stores the return value in state. AppPeekTests Unit tests for the AppPeek preprocessor handler. Verifies that values can be read from integer and real arrays and stored into declared scalar variables in PreprocessorState. AppPokeTests Unit tests for the AppPoke preprocessor handler. Verifies behaviour for writing values into integer and real arrays in PreprocessorState. AppRealTests Unit tests for the AppReal preprocessor handler. Verifies real variable declaration and initialization behaviour and the resulting mutations to PreprocessorState. AppRect_MoveTo_Tests Unit tests for the BOOSE_App.AppRect and AppMoveTo commands via parser integration. api/BOOSE_App.VariableProcessor.html.summary: Class VariableProcessor Namespace BOOSE_App Assembly BOOSE_App.dll Preprocessing helper that walks raw program text, handles declarations/blocks and emits a preprocessed program suitable for the parser. public static class VariableProcessor Inheritance object VariableProcessor Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Methods Diagnose(string) Diagnostic helper: run the preprocessor and return a per-line trace describing which handler consumed or forwarded each input line and any error produced. Useful to debug why lines were removed. public static string Diagnose(string input) Parameters input string Returns string TryProcess(string, out string, out string) Try to preprocess the supplied program text. public static bool TryProcess(string input, out string output, out string errors) Parameters input string Raw program text (may contain declarations, blocks and comments). output string On success contains the preprocessed program text (lines separated by the current environment newline). errors string On failure or partial failures contains human-readable error messages (empty when no errors). Returns bool True when preprocessing completed without errors; false when any errors were produced.

api/BOOSE_App.html.title: Namespace BOOSE_App | MyBOOSE_Doc
api/BOOSE_App.html.summary: Namespace BOOSE_App Classes AppArray Handles array declarations of the form: array int name = <sizeExpr> array real name = <sizeExpr> Also accepts the shorthand without '=': array int name <sizeExpr> Creates and registers the array in the preprocessor state. AppBoolean Preprocessor line handler for boolean declarations and optional initialization. Recognises lines of the form: "boolean <name>" (declare) "boolean <name> = <expr>" (declare and initialise) When handled the declaration is consumed by the preprocessor (no runtime output) and the named boolean variable is created/updated in the provided IPreprocessorState. AppCanvas Simple bitmap canvas implementation of ICanvas from BOOSE Provides basic drawing methods like moveto, drawto, circle, rect, tri, writetext. AppCanvasSingleton Simple singleton holder for AppCanvas. Provides a non-invasive wrapper so the application can obtain a single shared canvas instance without changing the concrete AppCanvas implementation. AppCircle Circle command to enable unrestricted circle drawing. Lets user input higher radius values. AppCommandFactory Factory that creates application-specific BOOSE.ICommand instances. Returns application-provided command implementations for commands the application overrides (for example "circle", "rect", "moveto") and delegates to the base BOOSE.CommandFactory for any other command names. AppFor Preprocessor block handler for FOR...END FOR constructs. The handler unrolls FOR loops at preprocess time, updating IPreprocessorState and emitting the runtime lines that should be executed for each iteration. AppIfs Simple block handler for IF / ELSEIF / ELSE / END IF constructs used by the preprocessor. AppInt Preprocessor line handler for integer declarations and optional initialization. Recognises lines of the form: "int <name>" (declare) "int <name> = <expr>" (declare and initialise) When handled the declaration is consumed by the preprocessor (no runtime output) and the named integer variable is created/updated in the provided IPreprocessorState. AppMethod Preprocessor handler for METHOD ... END METHOD blocks and CALL invocations. AppMoveTo Command that moves the current pen position to a specifc coordinate on the canvas AppPeek Handles "peek target = arrName index" preprocessing lines. Reads an element from an integer or real array and stores it in a declared scalar variable. AppPoke Handles preprocessing lines of the form poke <array> <indexExpr> = <expr>. Evaluates the index and expression, and writes the computed value into the named integer or real array in the provided IPreprocessorState. This handler consumes the source line (does not forward it). AppReal Handles preprocessing lines that declare or initialize real (double) variables: "real name" declares a real variable with initial value 0.0 "real name = <expr>" declares (or updates) a real variable with the evaluated expression value AppWhile Simple block handler for WHILE ... END WHILE Evaluates the boolean condition and processes the loop body repeatedly at preprocess time, updating IPreprocessorState and emitting the runtime lines produced each iteration. ExpressionEvaluator Small expression evaluator used by preprocessing handlers. Implements IExpressionEvaluator. Form1 Main application form for the BOOSE interpreter UI. Hosts the program inout textbox, a run button, an error log and a picture box that displays the drawing canvas. PreprocessorState Shared state used by preprocessing handlers. Implements IPreprocessorState. VariableProcessor Preprocessing helper that walks raw program text, handles declarations/blocks and emits a preprocessed program suitable for the parser. Interfaces IExpressionEvaluator Abstraction for expression evaluation used by handlers and the preprocessor. ILineHandler Represents a preprocessing line handler. Implementations inspect a single source line and may consume it (perform actions against the IPreprocessorState) or produce a transformed line to be forwarded to the parser. IPreprocessorState Abstraction for the state used by preprocessing handlers.
